text: <extra_id_0> 1,25-Dihydroxyvitamin D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA : expression in hematopoietic cells .

1 , 25-Dihydroxyvitamin D3 [ 1 , 25 ( OH ) 2D3 ] induces differentiation and inhibits proliferation of myeloid leukemic cells from various lines and patients ; these effects are probably mediated through the <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Little is known of expression of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA in hematopoietic cells .
We examined the expression and modulation of expression of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA in various proliferating and nonproliferating hematopoietic cells .

Constitutive expression of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA was detected in various kinds of hematopoietic cells , including macrophages and activated T lymphocytes , as well as in cell lines KG-1 ( myeloblasts ) , HL-60 ( promyelocytes ) , ML-3 ( myelomonoblasts ) , U937 , THP-1 ( monoblasts ) , K562 ( erythroblasts ) , and S - LB1 ( HTLV-1 - transfected T lymphocytes ) .
Receptor transcripts were 4.6 kilobases ( kb ) , and no variant sizes were observed .
All cell lines examined in this group also expressed <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Most B lymphocyte lines expressed negligible levels of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA and protein ; however ; analysis of a lymphoid / myeloid somatic hybrid suggested that suppression of expression of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA in B lymphocytes may be a dominant characteristic .

HL-60 cells were cultured with 10 ( -7 ) mol / L 1 , 25 ( OH ) 2D3 for 24 to 72 hours , and levels of expression of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and its RNA were examined .
Levels of RNA coding for the receptor were not modulated by exposure to high levels of ligand .

Levels of occupied <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein increased in these HL-60 cells ; but the total number of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> decreased about 50 % at 24 hours and returned toward normal at 72 hours .
Steady-state levels of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA were not affected by terminal differentiation of HL-60 toward either granulocytes or macrophages .
Nondividing macrophages from normal individuals also expressed <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA .

In contrast , nondividing peripheral blood lymphocytes from normal individuals did not express <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA ; with stimulation of proliferation of these cells , accumulation of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA increased markedly .

Half-life ( t1 / 2 ) of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA in T lymphocytes was short ( 1 hour ) as determined by measuring decay of the message after addition of actinomycin D . Consistent with this short t1 / 2 , accumulation of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA increased in cells as their protein synthesis was inhibited .
Further studies are required to understand the physiologic role of <extra_id_0> 1,25(OH)2D3 receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in myeloid cells and proliferating T lymphocytes .
